results.title: Metro
results.creator_credit: Touchstone Pictures, Ray Murray Jr, Randy Fedlman and Thomas Carter
results.brief_description: Eddie Murphy utilises his manic comic skills as a hostage negotiator working for the San Francisco Police Department. His cool-under-fire demeanour is tested when his girlfriend is taken hostage by a man who was also responsible for the death of a friend and colleague. Starring Eddie Murphy, Michael Rapaport, and Michael Wincott.

results.title: Metal skin
results.creator_credit: Daniel Scharf Productions, Southern Star Entertainment, Daniel Scharf and Geoffrey Wright
results.brief_description: After the controversial success of “Romper Stomper”, Geoffrey Wright’s second feature was a critical and commercial failure. However, this story about four young teenagers who find their only joy and exhileration in drag racing, is a mesmerising study of contemporary working class alienation. Set in Melbourne’s western suburbs the film is a hyper-kinetic study of the fractures and tensions at play in Australian society. The young cast is excellent as is the editing and cinematography.

results.title: Merrill's marauders
results.creator_credit: Warner Bros Pictures, United States Pictures, Milton Sperling and Samuel Fuller
results.brief_description: The viewer is plunged directly into war. The documentary element - the reconstruction of the campaign of General Merrill’s American infantry regiment deep behind Japanese lines in Burma - seems to exist on a level independent of the more stylised attempt to abstract the rhythms of combat and survival. Because he experienced combat at first hand as an infantry man in World War II, Fuller has a certain commitment to represent that reality thus bringing the contradictions between re-creation and generic convention closer to the surface than is usual for the combat genre.

results.title: Mermaids (Captioned)
results.creator_credit: Nicita/Lloyd Productions, Palmer, Lauren Lloyd, Wallis Nicita, Patrick Palmer and Richard Benjamin
results.brief_description: Winona Ryder plays a strict Catholic schoolgirl growing up in the conservative early sixties and saddled with the grooviest and sexiest mother in town. A very funny romantic comedy, “Mermaids” celebrates the tensions, love and agonies of mother-daughter relationships. With Bob Hoskins and featuring an outstanding performance by Cher as the free-spirited mother of a very unconventional family. Based on the book by Patty Dann.

results.title: Mercury rising
results.creator_credit: Universal City Studios Productions, Brian Grazer, Karen Kehela and Harold Becker
results.brief_description: Simon (Miko Hughes), a nine year old autistic boy cracks a code that has a lot of people worried - MERCURY, the most advanced (and expensive) encryption code the U.S government has. Simon comes across the enigma hidden in a puzzle magazine (an orchestrated move by the NSA who designed MERCURY and wanted to test their brainchild out on real people), and when he calls for the prize triggers an alarm at the National Security Agency. NSA Chief Nicholas Kudrow (Alec Baldwin) hires an assassin to kill Simon, believing this is the only way to stop the threat to national security. The only hope Simon has for survival lies with renegade FBI agent Art Jeffries (Bruce Willis), a man willing to protect the emotionally unpredictable child who has no-one else to turn to when ruthless Federal agents are out to get him. The task will take Jeffries muscle power and Simon’s special ability to be successful. Based on the novel “Simple Simon” by Ryne Douglas Pearson. Cast also includes Chi McBride and Kim Dickens.

results.title: Mephisto [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Ma Film, Manfred Durniok and Istvan Szabo
results.brief_description: Based on the novel by Klaus Mann, “Mephisto” is the story of one man’s struggle between his art and his morality. Set in Germany of the 1930s, “Mephisto” plots the rise of provincial actor Hendrik Hoefgen (Klaus Maria Brandauer) and the simultaneous rise of Nazism in Europe. Hoefgan is a talented, if vain actor who is not above flattery and manipulation of those around him to achieve his ambitious ends. A man who once had left wing political leanings, Hoefgen is forced to renounce his personal politics and even betray former colleagues in order to gain favour with the Nazis and advance his career. “Mephisto” is a compelling portrait of an artist whose ambition is in conflict with his integrity. The mood and aesthetics of 1930s Berlin are aptly evoked in this award winning drama (Oscar for Best Foreign Film, 1982). Directed by Istran Durnoik (Sunshine, Meeting Venus) and also starring Krystyna Janda and Ildiko Bansagi.

results.title: Memphis Belle
results.creator_credit: Bountiful Company Ltd, David Puttnam, Catherine Wyler and Michael Caton-Jones
results.brief_description: The Memphis Belle is a B-17 World War II bomber, piloted by a young crew of ten men on dangerous bombing raids into Europe. Thus far they have flown 24 perilous missions, they are about to embark on mission 25 - a daylight raid on Bremen that is there most dangerous to date, and the one thing that stands between them and home. The expectations for success were high, as completing the 25th mission would earn the crew the prestigious position of being the first crew to complete all 25 missions in the 8th Airforce. Cinemagoers first saw the exploits of the Memphis Belle in a 1944 documentary by William Wyler (also available in the collection). Using this documentary as inspiration, the producers David Puttnam and Catherine Wyler embarked on a mission to produce a film that included real B-17’s and other vintage planes, as well as impressive models and authentic footage as a backdrop to the story of friendship, action and heroics. The cast includes Matthew Modine, Eric Stoltz, Tate Donovan, D. B. Sweeney, Billy Zane, Sean Astin, Harry Connick Jnr, Reed Edward Diamond, Coutney Gains and Neil Giuntoli.

results.title: Memories of underdevelopment = Memorias del subdesarrollo
results.creator_credit: Instituto Cubano del Arte e Industrias Cinematográficos (ICAIC), Miguel Mendoza and Tomas Gutierrez Alea
results.brief_description: ‘Memories of Underdevelopment’ is the diary of a middle-class intellectual caught in the midst of the rapidly changing social reality of revolutionary Cuba. Sergio is a landlord and self-styled writer who decides to remain behind when his wife, family and friends, whom he ridicules, leave for Miami. But Sergio is unable to commit himself to the revolution either, and so remains only a sceptical observer. His perceptions of Cuban society, both before and after the revolution, are skillfully interwoven with documentary footage of historical events (the Bay of Pigs invasion, the Cuban Missile Crisis of 1962, and so on) to yield a complex and fascinating portrait of an individual alienated from the social process around him. Based on the novel by Esmundo Desnoes. In Spanish with English subtitles. Cast includes Sergio Corrieri, Daisy Granados, Eslinda Nunez, Omar Valdes and Rene de la Cruz.

results.title: Memento [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Newmarket Films, Suzanne Todd, Jennifer Todd and Christopher Nolan
results.brief_description: The second feature by Christopher Nolan accomplishes what seems impossible: to tell a movie backwards. Leonard (Guy Pearce) is a former Insurance Investigator whose successful career was cut short by a violent incident which deprived him of his ability to make new memories, transforming his life into an epic quest for vengeance. But his mental condition makes him vulnerable to those who would take advantage, and the lengths to which he’ll go to give his life some logic prove frightening. A disorienting but ultimately ingenious thriller. Cast also includes Joe Pantoliano and Carrie-Anne Moss.
